per_sample.article: Scientists at the Indian Institute of Space Research have successfully tested a new reusable launch vehicle prototype off the coast of Andhra Pradesh. Engineers say the data gathered from this flight will shape the design of a larger vehicle capable of cutting launch costs by more than 50 percent. The mission, which lasted just under 15 minutes, is seen as a key milestone in India's effort to compete in the global commercial launch market. Officials stressed that at least half a dozen more tests will be needed before a full-scale demonstration, but called the debut "a major step toward low-cost access to space."

The court found that the platforms exercised significant control over working hours, pricing and performance metrics, making the gig workers functionally indistinguishable from traditional staff. Industry groups warned the ruling could increase costs and lead to higher prices for consumers, while labor advocates hailed it as a victory for precarious workers. Lawmakers are now expected to draft new regulations to clarify how the decision will be implemented nationwide.
